Ever since I was very young Iâ€™ve had this ingrained fear and paranoia of being kidnapped and murdered. I have no idea where it came from, but looking back that was where my battles with anxiety began. I have vivid memories of eyeing older men in stores and making sure they werenâ€™t following me, and waking up every single night in the early morning and just listening for sounds of someone in my house. There were many instances where I was sure I was about to die. I imagined how it would happen over and over. It took a long time for me to realize that wasnâ€™t normal. That anxiety has lessened some over the years, but is definitely still there. I absolutely hate going anywhere alone at night, and Iâ€™m always hyper aware of my surroundings. 

Anyways, youâ€™re not alone! Anxiety is a bitch, and itâ€™s great of convincing us that our fears are real.

Does anyone else live with or know someone who subscribes to the idea that this situation is largely a hoax and being exaggerated by the government to control citizens or something along those lines? 

My dad is apparently a conspiracy theorist, and is now constantly watching videos that portray this whole situation as not being a real threat. He doesnâ€™t think any of these measures being taken are necessary. 

I think itâ€™s important to not succumb to the doomsday mindset, but heâ€™s gone the completely opposite way and itâ€™s driving me crazy. When people think this way they stop being cautious and start putting other people at risk against their wills.

Iâ€™m sorry to hear that. Remember, the vast majority of those who get tested (~90%), and therefore have symptoms, are negative. I wish the best for your friend. Iâ€™m not an expert, but where did you hear 20 days? I have not heard that, and if it didnâ€™t come from a respected health expert I would not put stock in it. Iâ€™d think they wouldnâ€™t keep the quarantine period at 14 days if that was the case.
Awesome! Hopefully they try this out in NY soon
Iâ€™m glad! You deserve it!

My take is that you canâ€™t completely avoid anxiety in this current situation, I guess unless you pretend itâ€™s not happening. The goal should be to learn to manage it and know your limits. Itâ€™s important to have a realistic view, which is where I think this thread comes in. Iâ€™m still anxious at times, but coming here feels safe and definitely minimizes it a lot. It may not be for everyone, but they have the choice to not come here then.

Weâ€™ll thatâ€™s not fair at all. You donâ€™t owe any of us anything, and for you to take just a few minutes out of your day trying to life the spirits of a bunch of strangers is so kind and generous of you. Thereâ€™s lots here that appreciate what youâ€™re doing, pay attention to them.
Ugh yes! Constantly on even when no one is watching. And my dad is constantly watching conspiracy videos on his phone so everyone can hear ğŸ¤¦ğŸ¼â€â™€ï¸

Recoveries require testing negative twice with 24 hours between. From what Iâ€™ve heard, which makes sense,  this is not a priority and tends to lag a lot behind actual recoveries. By minimizing the number of recoveries that are reported, the death rate in turn appears higher. The death rate is much more likely to be accurate (aside from the issue of reporting covid-19 as the cause of death for everyone that had it and died) and be reported in a timely manner. Also, correct me if Iâ€™m wrong, but even in mild cases it seems that the illness lingers for a while, so testing negative may take weeks, even if one feels they have recovered. Chances are the recovery rate is much higher than those numbers.
Yes! I meant to say that too. Unfortunately, it seems it takes a while to die from this.. so deaths will likely be occurring for a while past peak.

I know looking at the numbers can be discouraging, and I truly hope we start to see evidence of things turning around for them. 

I looked it up and nationwide lockdown went into effect March 9th in Italy, which granted feels like a year ago, but was just under 3 weeks ago now. So much can change in a week, and it takes time for things to slow down after making these changes. It also looks like restaurants and bars werenâ€™t closed until March 11. Within 2 or so weeks there likely still be people starting to have symptoms who were exposed before these restrictions, and within a longer period some who got infected before might start having more severe symptoms. This is just my interpretation though, hopefully in the next week or so a decline becomes more evident.

Agreed! I rely almost solely on his daily updates, and they never make me more anxious. Heâ€™s realistic, but also reassuring. His handling of the situation has made me much more optimistic for my states future.

Hospitalization numbers in NY have been increasing at slower rates over the past week or so. This suggests that the spread may be slowing some. They went from doubling every 2 days to now every 5 days or so (this may be even longer now as that data was reported yesterday). Hopefully this trend continues!


https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.marketwatch.com/amp/story/guid/A6391CA8-6EF1-11EA-94E2-ED6135F15A3F

Yes, nights hit me hard, even when Iâ€™m relatively fine throughout the day. I also canâ€™t see my boyfriend right now, which has been a tough transition. Iâ€™m sorry you have all these other things that are getting messed with because of this :/ it sucks. Iâ€™ve been trying to distract myself until Iâ€™m exhausted and just pass out, which helps some so Iâ€™m not laying in bed ruminating. Iâ€™m currently really missing my boyfriend, but trying to just focus on why we have to do this, and how amazing it will be when weâ€™re reunited. Best wishes.
Yes I have been all over the place lately, itâ€™s exhausting.
From my understanding every area is following a different curve. NY is predicting their peak to be in about 14 days now, but we seem to be ahead of most other places in the country.

Is anyone else worried that Trump will lift restrictions prematurely by the way heâ€™s talking? As much as I hate being quarantined, I donâ€™t want things to get worse. 

Would it ultimately be up to our state governments since they have their own restrictions??
Of course, it definitely helped me to realize there were many others in similar situations. Iâ€™m hoping for that as well! Feel free to message me if you want to talk about it any more.

Hi there. Iâ€™m going through the same thing at the moment, Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™re struggling. My boyfriend doesnâ€™t live far from me, but my family is isolated, and he is still working and having contact with various people on a daily basis. So we made the decision to stop seeing each other for the time being. Iâ€™m very anxious not knowing how long this will last, and going from seeing him almost everyday to going weeks or longer without.

Itâ€™s especially difficult since my anxiety is so high right now. I wish so badly he was here to comfort me, but I know my efforts are making it so we can be together again soon. Iâ€™m just trying to focus on the fact that this is temporary, and on how great it will be when we are reunited. We also agreed we would FaceTime every night, so I know I have that to look forward to in the meantime.

I hope all goes well for you!

If anything Iâ€™m this person to my family. Overall I do think itâ€™s a big adjustment for many, which will take time, and likely will include days that are worse than others. 

I think itâ€™s important to give him a little space, while also making it known regularly that youâ€™re there for him. Try to converse with him about what heâ€™s feeling if he seems open to it, or maybe heâ€™d rather talk about a completely unrelated topic. Itâ€™s a tough spot to see what is happening to someone when they canâ€™t. Maybe talking to his doctor over the phone or video chat will help?

Is there something he enjoys that you can try to get him engaged in? Maybe you can find a lighthearted show to watch together? Distraction during this time is helpful Iâ€™ve found, but not always easy I understand. 

I hope things get better for you all. Itâ€™s a very difficult transition for many people, myself included, but things will get better.
You work during this tough time is so greatly appreciated! Thank you for all that you do. Stay safe.
Good morning. Thank you so much for taking your time to spread positivity right now, it is greatly appreciated!

Hey, Iâ€™m in the same position. My boyfriend lives 10 minutes from me and normally I go back and forth between my familyâ€™s house and his. Heâ€™s a mail carrier so potentially has lots of contact with people on a daily basis. Iâ€™m living at home with my family. Weâ€™ve been struggling to figure out the best course of action, but have decided that itâ€™s best for now not to see each other for now.

Iâ€™m heartbroken over it, and physical touch is also one of my top love languages. Iâ€™m just trying to remind myself constantly that it is only temporary and focus on how great it will be when we get to see each other again. Also do make sure to talk to each other about how often you want/need to communicate and by which means (text, phone call, video chat). It sucks having to be in a â€œlong distanceâ€ relationship when they arenâ€™t far, but we will get through it.

Feel free to message me if you want to talk more! I wish you the best

What has helped me the most so far, besides mainly focusing on the positive advancements, is distraction. Personally Iâ€™ve been searching for light hearted shows that I can get engaged in and forget about whatâ€™s going  on for a little. Iâ€™ve also worked on some art projects. What you enjoy may be different, but distracting myself helps when my anxiety begins to feel overwhelming. 

Keep in contact with loved ones, and focus on what you can change in the moment. Come here when you need support. I wish you the best!

I know this may seem trivial in the grand scheme of things.. but currently Iâ€™m struggling because I just made the decision to isolate myself from my boyfriend. I live at home with my family, who are staying home for the most part. He lives alone and comes into contact with many people at work every day, so I made the decision to keep a distance for the time being. Weâ€™ve never done anything close to long distance, we normally see each other almost everyday. Iâ€™m worried about how it will affect our relationship. He drives by my house to get to and from work, itâ€™s so difficult to make this choice, but I know I have to do my part to minimize the spread.

Does anyone have tips to manage anxiety in this situation? Or to maintain our relationship successfully in the meantime? 

I hope you are all doing alright out there!

No country would survive if this was permanent, and all evidence points to otherwise. Iâ€™m not highly educated on the topic, but we survived the Spanish flu, which was much worse, and that was 100 years ago. There was no spreading of information quickly through the internet (positive and negative aspects), meaning widespread effective intervention likely wasnâ€™t possible (this is speculation). The world was a very different place, particularly in the medical field. Today we have the promising possibility for effective medical interventions to emerge in the near future. And yet even 100 years ago we recovered and moved on from it without these advancements. 

We will get passed this. We will recover. We have to support each other in the mean time and do our part to mitigate the impact.

Thank you so much! You're contribution has played a big role in calming me down. I appreciate, as do many others, you taking the time to sift through tons of information and raise our hopes in these tough times.

understandable. It made me panic every time I heard or even read about this lasting for months just a few days ago. But then I read more and realized that is what we want, that is the goal of isolation and quarantine. We want to slow the spread, which inevitably will take longer than if we took no action. However, this will also lessen the negative impact on the entire world, which is promising. This gives us time to adapt to our new normal, which we can and will do, while also keeping hope that it will just be temporary. 

Do your best to distract yourself and focus on the positive advancements that are happening every day. And come back here when you need support. We are all in this together.

Thank you for response. Iâ€™ve considered that maybe it is me and Iâ€™ve just been unaware to how Iâ€™ve been acting. Ever since we graduated Iâ€™m the only one whose made any effort to hangout. I made the plans to see their apartment and we were all supposed to go out this weekend, which was originally my idea. In our group chat this friend told our other two friends to bring their boyfriends this weekend, and said nothing of mine, which gave me the first hint she doesnâ€™t like him for some reason. If she had a legitimate reason Iâ€™d hope she would tell me privately and from a caring standpoint. 

I value my friendships greatly, and try hard to balance my time, which is much harder now that I donâ€™t live with my friends. I think itâ€™s inevitable that getting into a relationship means youâ€™ll spend less time with other people, thatâ€™s just how time works. Not to mention when this friend first met her boyfriend she went to his house every single night, and I said nothing. I let her talk about him as much as she wants, and if somethings relevant Iâ€™ll say something about mine. Iâ€™m trying hard to see where sheâ€™s coming from, but I donâ€™t understand it. I guess Iâ€™ll just give her space for a little and see what happens.

It matters because I care more than I probably should about what other people think, and I know I do. Currently trying to work on that. But also as my friend I do value her opinion, and up until now she never gave any hint that she didnâ€™t like him... sheâ€™s even told me she did on multiple occasions. It just took me aback that she lashed out at me like that.

Hm, maybe. But itâ€™s more than just the comment, she canâ€™t support or be happy for me and my relationship. Thatâ€™s not a friendship. If she had legitimate reasons not to like him and expressed those to me from a caring standpoint, I could understand. I guess I just want friends that are happy for me when I am, rather than hurtful instead

Haha I donâ€™t think youâ€™re old, but I donâ€™t know, itâ€™s not unusual for us to talk about our relationships, how theyâ€™re going and whatever else. I guess I didnâ€™t think anything of it, I was mostly just proud of my diy skills bc I normally suck at making things

She said she didnâ€™t like him. This all came out of nowhere. I make an effort to talk to all of them about their lives, boyfriends, etc. Even if she is annoyed about it, I donâ€™t feel like that was the best way to go about it.
